body:
The options argument was missing so the argument data wasn't the right one and the method cb_disabled was actually called on a GVariant* instead on a PortalInputCapture*

This probably fix #8147 because in implementations when the screen size change, the `disabled` signal is sent, but that call is not handle by us due to a bad signature, this lead to a stall.

 - [x] Tested on GNOME
 - [x] Tested on KDE
 - [ ] Tested on Hyprland

Your commit is not in line with our Code Standards

Please fix your commit message use a prefix (rule: [#1](https://github.com/deskflow/deskflow/wiki/Hacking-Guide#1-prefix-your-commits-with-a-commit-type)) 

also update the copyright info on the files you have edited (rule: [#4](https://github.com/deskflow/deskflow/wiki/Hacking-Guide#4-update-file-license-info))
What about the other suggestion from Whot ?

If you are talking about https://github.com/input-leap/input-leap/pull/2166#pullrequestreview-2576976726, i did a detailed answer in https://github.com/input-leap/input-leap/pull/2166#discussion_r1935637884, those calls are good because libportal extract for us the `activation_id` argument for easy access.

1. the commit message should start with "fix:"  
2. We are REUSE compliant so its encouraged for commits to also update the copyright info on files w/ non trivial changes.  

> Testing with GNOME now.

i put checkboxes in the description use them (add more if you use other DEs)

> Testing with GNOME now.

Sadly does not fix #8147 but also doesn't seem to make it any worse :)
I will test on Hyprland tomorrow
